title: 4C Mortality Score for COVID-19
description: Predicts in-hospital mortality in patients admitted with COVID-19

parameters.name: comorbidities
parameters.description: Number of comorbidities (chronic heart disease, chronic lung disease except asthma, CKD with GFR ≤30, mild-severe liver disease, dementia, chronic neurological diseases, connective tissue diseases, diabetes, HIV/AIDS, malignancy)

ranges.interpretation: In-hospital mortality of 1.2-1.7%. Low-risk patients may be considered for early discharge or outpatient management if clinically stable.
In-hospital mortality of 9.1-9.9%. Patients require standard hospital monitoring with vigilance for clinical deterioration.
In-hospital mortality of 31.4-34.9%. Patients require intensive care or high-dependency unit monitoring.
In-hospital mortality of 61.5-66.2%. Patients require immediate intensive care and consideration of support limitation if appropriate.

references: Knight SR, Ho A, Pius R, et al. Risk stratification of patients admitted to hospital with covid-19 using the ISARIC WHO Clinical Characterisation Protocol: development and validation of the 4C Mortality Score. BMJ. 2020;370:m3339.

Gupta RK, Marks M, Samuels THA, et al. Systematic evaluation and external validation of 22 prognostic models among hospitalised adults with COVID-19: an observational cohort study. Eur Respir J. 2020;56(6):2003498.
formula: Points = Age (0-7) + Sex (0-1) + Comorbidities (0-2) + RR (0-2) + SpO2 (0-2) + Glasgow (0-2) + Urea (0-3) + CRP (0-2)
notes: Apply only to hospitalized patients with confirmed COVID-19

Comorbidities include: chronic heart disease, chronic lung disease (except asthma), CKD (GFR ≤30), mild-severe liver disease, dementia, chronic neurological diseases, connective tissue diseases, diabetes, HIV/AIDS, malignancy
Developed using data from the ISARIC4C consortium of UK patients
Does not apply to outpatient or emergency department patients
